p: The aerial parts of M. fruticosa serpyllifolia were collected in April of 2017 from three cities in the West Bank (WB) in Palestine: Nablus, Ramallah, and Hebron representing north, middle, and south of the WB in Palestine, respectively. The samples were botanically identified and coded by Dr. Nidal Jaradat, the pharmacognosist at the Department of Pharmacy in Pharmacognosy and Herbal Products Laboratory, An-Najah National University, and the voucher specimen code was Pharm-PCT-1575. The extraction of VOs was performed following the procedure in accordance to [ 19, 20].
